document.heading: District Department of the Environment Establishment Act of 2005

history.narrative: Law 16-51, the “District Department of the Environment Establishment Act of 2005”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-16 which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 6, 2005, and November 15, 2005, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 2, 2005, it was assigned Act No. 16-213 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-51 became effective on February 15, 2006.
